Job Title: iSeries/BY Senior Techno Functional Consultant – L3
Ad Text:
We are HCLTech, one of the fastest-growing large tech companies in the world and home to 219,000+ people across 54 countries, supercharging progress through industry-leading capabilities centered around Digital, Engineering and Cloud.

The driving force behind that work, our people, are diverse, creative, and passionate, raising the bar for excellence on a regular basis. We, in turn, work hard to bring out the best in them as we strive to help them find their spark and become the best version of themselves that they can be.

Are you ready to be an important part of this ever-transformational journey?

At HCLTech Australia, we value the unique perspective and contributions of all individual and we actively encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people to apply for this role.

OVERVIEW OF THE ROLE

As an iSeries/BY Senior Techno Functional Consultant – L3, you will play a pivotal role in bridging the gap between business requirements and technical solutions, leveraging your expertise in iSeries and Blue Yonder (BY) platforms. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, implement, and optimize enterprise solutions, ensuring alignment with client objectives and HCLTech’s standards of innovation and quality. This role is critical to delivering value-driven technology solutions that drive operational efficiency and business growth.

DETAILED RESPONSIBILITIES

Lead the analysis, design, and implementation of iSeries and Blue Yonder (BY) solutions for enterprise-level clients.

Gather and interpret business requirements to develop functional and technical specifications.

Collaborate with stakeholders to deliver end-to-end techno-functional solutions, ensuring optimal integration with existing systems.

Provide expert guidance in solution architecture, process optimization, and best practices for iSeries/BY environments.

Oversee the configuration, customization, and support of BY applications, including troubleshooting and issue resolution.

Manage project deliverables, timelines, and documentation in accordance with HCLTech’s quality standards.

Mentor and provide technical leadership to junior consultants and development teams.

Facilitate user training sessions and ensure effective knowledge transfer to client teams.

Stay abreast of industry trends, new technologies, and emerging best practices to maintain a competitive edge.

SKILL REQUIREMENTS

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or a related field.

7+ years of experience in techno-functional consulting with a focus on iSeries (AS/400) and Blue Yonder (BY) platforms.

Strong knowledge of enterprise application architecture, business process mapping, and systems integration.

Expertise in RPG, CL, COBOL programming languages, and DB2 database management on iSeries.

Hands-on experience with Blue Yonder modules such as WMS, TMS, or Demand Planning.

Proven ability to translate business needs into technical solutions and deliver high-impact results.

Excellent communication, stakeholder management, and problem-solving skills.

Experience with project management methodologies and tools.

OTHER REQUIREMENTS (OPTIONAL)

Professional certifications in Blue Yonder, IBM iSeries, or project management (PMP, PRINCE2) are highly desirable.

Experience working in multinational or large enterprise environments.

Familiarity with Agile/Scrum methodologies.

Ability to travel domestically or internationally as required.

Why Us

We are one of the fastest-growing large tech companies in the world, with offices in 50+ countries across the globe and 219,000 employees.

Our company is extremely diverse with 165 nationalities represented.

We offer the opportunity to work with colleagues across the globe.

We offer a virtual-first work environment, promoting a good work-life integration and real flexibility.

We offer comprehensive benefits for all employees.

We are a certified great place to work and a top employer in 17 countries, offering a positive work environment that values employee recognition and respect.

Equality & Opportunity for All

Representing 165 nationalities across the globe, we pride ourselves on being an equal opportunity employer, committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees regardless of race, religion, sex, color, age, national origin, pregnancy, sexual orientation, physical disability or genetic information, military or veteran status, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people or any other protected classification, in accordance with federal, state, and/or local law.

Note: Please follow the link to apply to the role with your recent resume. If you need more details, feel free to contact Nicy on nicy.kurian@hcltech.com.

Candidate Data Privacy Notice | HCL Technologies

We are committed to respecting your privacy and for the protection of your personal data. Your personal data will be collected and processed in line with our candidate privacy notice: https://www.hcltech.com/candidate-privacy-notice. About the Role
As an AI Security Architect be part of the Architecture & Delivery (A&D) team, driving secure architecture and end‑to‑end solution design. The focus is on Generative AI (GenAI) and Machine Learning (ML) initiatives where secure reference architectures and designs are essential.

Key Responsibilities

Embed security‑by‑design across AI models, data, APIs, and integrations to ensure systems are resilient, compliant, and scalable.
Champion DevSecOps and strong application security practices in all projects.
Create secure solution‑architecture artifacts for AI/ML initiatives, from design through to operations handover.
Perform AI‑specific threat modelling (e.g. adversarial attacks, prompt injection, model/data leakage) and enforce secure patterns.
Develop and maintain reusable AI security reference architectures and patterns, aligned with enterprise architecture and regulatory requirements.
Provide technical leadership and guidance to stakeholders, promoting adoption of secure AI / integration patterns.
Maintain architecture documentation and relevant tools (e.g. LeanIX).
Ideal Candidate Profile

Deep experience in enterprise solution architecture with AI/ML systems and cloud‑native platforms (AWS, Azure, etc.).
Proven experience in security architecture and integration patterns.
Comfortable working in agile / DevSecOps contexts.
Excellent communication, stakeholder management, and problem‑solving skills.
Preferred Knowledge

Familiarity with GenAI security patterns (e.g. LLM baseline protections, SaaS GenAI integration).
Understanding of regulatory / AI security frameworks (Australian Privacy Act, GDPR, NIST CSF, OWASP AI/LLM Top 10, and MITRE ATLAS) Practical DevSecOps+2MITRE ATLAS+2.
Strong knowledge of integration styles like REST APIs, event‑driven architectures (Kafka, GraphQL, API Gateway).
Application security tools / practices such as SAST, DAST, CI/CD.

Does this sound like you? If you have the skills and experience, we're looking for please click 'Apply Now', or please send your updated CV to suniva.rego@mtr.com.au Alternatively please call 03 9643 3720 for a confidential discussion about the role.

Are you a data science expert passionate about AI innovation and stakeholder influence? We’re seeking a Staff Data Scientist to drive cutting-edge AI advancements while working closely with executives and non-technical stakeholders to shape AI adoption and impact.
This role is ideal for someone who thrives at the intersection of technical excellence and business strategy, ensuring AI solutions deliver real value across the organisation.

About the Role
As a Lead or Principal Data Scientist, you will play a crucial role in developing and deploying machine learning models, optimising AI performance, and influencing key business decisions. Your expertise in NLP, LLMs, and MLOps will drive innovation, while your ability to communicate complex AI concepts to executives will ensure AI initiatives align with business objectives.
This is a high-visibility role where you’ll work across teams, bridging the gap between technical execution and business strategy—helping senior stakeholders understand the power of AI and how to apply it effectively.

Key Responsibilities
AI Strategy & Business Alignment – Work closely with executives and business leaders to integrate AI-driven solutions into company strategy.
Technical Leadership – Design, develop, and optimise machine learning models, with a focus on NLP and large-scale AI applications.
Executive Stakeholder Influence – Translate complex AI concepts into clear, actionable insights for non-technical leaders.
MLOps & AI Engineering – Implement best practices for model deployment, monitoring, and performance optimisation at scale.
Data-Driven Decision Making – Drive high-impact AI initiatives by leveraging advanced analytics on structured and unstructured data.
Research & Innovation – Stay ahead of AI trends, applying cutting-edge techniques to enhance business performance and operational efficiency.
What You’ll Bring
8+ years of experience (Staff Level) in data science, AI, and machine learning, with strong expertise in NLP and LLMs.
A track record of engaging with C-suite and senior business stakeholders, influencing AI strategy and execution.
Expert-level Python and SQL skills, with deep experience in building and deploying machine learning models at scale.
Hands-on experience with MLOps best practices, cloud-based AI solutions, and large-scale data processing.
A strategic mindset, with the ability to translate AI advancements into business impact.
Exceptional communication and influencing skills, able to simplify complex concepts for non-technical audiences.
What’s in It for You?
Work at the forefront of AI innovation, shaping strategy at a high-growth tech company.
Partner directly with executives and business leaders to drive enterprise-wide AI transformation.
Join a team that values curiosity, technical excellence, and real-world AI applications.
Hybrid work model (Sydney-based, 2-3 days in-office).
If you’re a highly experienced AI professional who can influence at an executive level while delivering cutting-edge AI solutions, we’d love to hear from you. Apply now!

About the role

We’re seeking an experienced Document Automation Specialist to join our team and lead the implementation of automation and AI strategies that will shape the future of document preparation and handling at Green Mortgage Lawyers.

This is a unique opportunity to work within a forward-thinking law firm, where your expertise in Microsoft Word styling, data merging, and document automation will be both valued and expanded. You’ll play a key role in modernising our document workflows, integrating emerging technologies such as OpenXML and AI-driven automation, and driving efficiency across the business.

Key responsibilities

Design and maintain complex Word templates using advanced styling, merge fields, and sub-documents.

Collaborate with internal stakeholders to automate complex and high-volume document workflows.

Develop and implement automation solutions using OpenXML and other low-code/no-code platforms.

Provide technical support and training to internal users on document automation tools.

Ensure all documentation adheres to brand and formatting standards.

Participate in testing, troubleshooting, and post-implementation support.

About you

Expert-level proficiency in Microsoft Word, including styles, merge fields, and sub-document handling.

Strong understanding of relational data structures and constraints.

Experience with OpenXML, HTML, and CSS is highly advantageous.

Familiarity with document automation platforms (e.g. HotDocs, Contract Express, or similar).

Excellent attention to detail and problem-solving skills.

Strong communication and stakeholder engagement abilities.

A proactive mindset with a desire to innovate and improve processes.

About us

At Green Mortgage Lawyers, we’re not just any law firm; we’re a Top Tier Independent Legal Firm built on 40 years of excellence in the banking and finance sector, proudly partnering with other Top Tier clients and brands. With over 160 talented lawyers, paralegals, and support professionals spanning Brisbane and Manila, we pride ourselves on offering a vibrant, inclusive culture. Here, you'll benefit from comprehensive training, professional development and mentoring from seasoned professionals while enjoying a work-life balance that truly values your well-being.

Why choose GML?

At Green Mortgage Lawyers, we’re not just offering a job; we’re providing an opportunity to elevate your career in a thriving legal environment. Here’s what sets us apart:

Empowerment: Take charge of your legal career with opportunities for leadership, ownership of projects, and the chance to make a real impact from day one.

Growth and Development: Benefit from tailored training programmes, mentorship from some of the best most respected professionals in the industry, and pathways for career advancement. Your success is our priority.

Inclusivity: Join a diverse team of brilliant lawyers, paralegals, and support staff who are passionate about excellence and your growth, celebrates different perspectives and encourages collaboration. Your voice matters here!

Stability and Reputation: Join a respected and high profile law firm celebrated for its excellence in commercial and retail legal mortgage services. Collaborate with top-tier clients and brands to enhance your personal brand and expand your professional capabilities.

Client Support Focus: Engage directly with clients to sharpen your communication style and build meaningful relationships. This hands-on experience will enhance your professional network and position you as a trusted advisor in the legal field.

Community Impact: Contribute to meaningful work that helps our clients and their borrowers to secure their financial futures, making a positive impact on the lives of others. 

How to apply

To apply, please submit your cover letter and CV via the link. If you have any questions about the role, please contact Sophie Sheather – Operations Manager on 07 3052 9058. 

Website https://greenmortgagelawyers.com/

Join a high-performing, forward-thinking team leading real impact in Data & AI.




We’re looking for an experienced consultant who was essentially born in the cloud—a natural in cloud-native technologies, with a passion for solving complex challenges and delivering enterprise-grade solutions.




You'll be joining a collaborative and high-calibre national Professional Services team within Data#3, where you’ll work across varied and innovative projects in data, AI, and modern application environments.




Who is Data#3?

Listed in 1997, Data#3 is now an ASX200 listed company reporting gross sales of $2.8 billion in the 2024 financial year. Headquartered in Brisbane with more than 1,400 employees, it has facilities across 12 locations in Australia and Fiji.




Voted HRD's Employer of Choice for the last 10 years and named one of Australia’s Best Workplaces in Technology by Great Place To Work® in 2024, Data#3's culture is built on five core values; Honesty, Excellence, Agility, Respect, and Teamwork (HEART). These values are integral to the way Data#3 works internally and externally with our customer.




In this role you will: 

Strong experience in solution design, systems integration, and enterprise-level deployment

Skilled in stakeholder engagement, project delivery, and technical leadership

Experience developing modern data platform solutions on Microsoft Fabric, Microsoft Azure data services (Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse), Apache Spark and/or Databricks or similar

Proficiency in coding with Python and SQL is essential

Deep understanding of data modelling, ETL processes and data warehousing principles and experience building robust data pipelines

Ability to capture business intelligence requirements and build reports in Power BI

Familiarity with modern data architecture patterns e.g. lakehouse medallion architecture

Experience with building solutions that leverage AI services or experience developing and training AI models is desirable.

Hands-on experience with cloud platforms, enterprise data strategies, and analytics tooling




About You 

Strong experience in solution design, systems integration, and enterprise-level deployment

Skilled in stakeholder engagement, project delivery, and technical leadership

Experience developing modern data platform solutions on Microsoft Fabric, Microsoft Azure data services (Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse), Apache Spark and/or Databricks or similar

Proficiency in coding with Python and SQL is essential

Deep understanding of data modelling, ETL processes and data warehousing principles and experience building robust data pipelines

Ability to capture business intelligence requirements and build reports in Power BI

Familiarity with modern data architecture patterns e.g. lakehouse medallion architecture

Experience with building solutions that leverage AI services or experience developing and training AI models is desirable.

Hands-on experience with cloud platforms, enterprise data strategies, and analytics tooling




If you’re looking to make an impact through cutting-edge work in data and AI—and want to grow with a high-calibre team delivering strategic transformation—we’d love to hear from you.




At Data#3, we value diversity, equity, and inclusion as key to a thriving workplace. We are committed to building a culture where everyone feels welcome, respected, and valued—and we encourage your application. 




Please note that Data#3 will request as part of the recruitment process, reference checks and verification of your right to work in Australia. You may also be required to undertake background checks and police checks for security clearance pertaining to specific job requirements.

Ad Text:
About us:

At Lockheed Martin Australia, we believe that when people are empowered, inspired, and supported, they can achieve extraordinary things. We embrace flexibility, so our people can be their best inside and outside of work. We champion inclusion and continuous learning, ensuring all voices are heard and valued. And we thrive on collaboration, turning challenges into opportunities for growth and innovation.  As a leader in national security, our innovative and diverse programs create a more secure future for Australia across space, air, land, sea, and cyber domains. Every day is a chance to solve the world’s most complex challenges and make a profound impact. Experience it here.

About the program

AIR6500 is the RAAF’s $3 billion program to develop a joint air battle management system that builds on the capabilities offered by Next Generation sensor and command and control systems. AIR6500 will create a fully networked ‘system of systems’ that synchronises air and missile defence operations in joint and coalition environments, maximising situational awareness and enhancing the speed of decision making across the battlespace.

Responsibilities

AIR6500 is a focussed LMA activity that includes exploring advanced web-based technologies for a Joint Air Battle Management System (JABMS) – A system that will interconnect the defence platforms, systems sensors and effectors across the war fighting domains, land, air, sea, space and cyber. As part of ongoing risk reduction, elements of a Joint All Domain Operational (JADO) command and control system will be explored.

Working as a Software Engineer as part of an Agile Scrum Integrated Product Team (IPT), you will be responsible for the development and delivery of features focusing on front-end and back-end elements, including technical ownership of designated software features. You will drive an industry best practice approach in a microservices based architecture. You will be responsible for the integration of technical deliverables.

In the daily performance of this role, you will be required to actively support the agile development of complex technical solutions proposed by yourself and team Subject Matter Experts, including the development of software requirement, design and test rationale and the implementation of code and unit test whilst overcoming project technical issues within an agile team environment.

You will also undertake activities with customers and team to identify, analyse, select and apply concepts, technologies and techniques that are applicable to the technical development of software products.

You will also be responsible for resolution of problems identified during the conduct of software development, integration and test of your products.

About you:

To be successful in this role you will also have:

·         Substantial knowledge of Software Engineering process, procedures and the overall engineering product lifecycle

·         Substantial experience in software engineering methodologies and techniques preferably in a web-based development domain

·         Substantial software development experience on Linux and Windows platforms

·         Strong ability to apply experiential judgement and lateral approaches to complex problem solving

Desirable

·         Experience with DevSecOps methodologies and toolsets

·         Experience in Web Development Toolsets (Angular/Typescript/etc.) and Backend Languages such as Go or Python.

·         Agile software development and team experience

·         Experience with container technologies and Cloud Orchestration platforms (Kubernetes)

How we reward and support you:

 When you join Lockheed Martin, you work on projects you won’t experience anywhere else.

We offer you a range of benefits built to suit you, no matter what stage of life you are in. 

·         Flexible work & Hybrid work options

·         Access to our online discounts program offering immediate discounts or cashback

·         A variety of leave options including Purchase Leave to support you and your family  

·         Additional benefits such as Novated Leasing and Fitness Programs

·         Learning & Development platforms to encourage ongoing self-development

Special Requirements:

Applicants must be eligible to obtain and maintain an Australian Defence Security Clearance and employment may be contingent on the provision of further personal information including citizenship to ensure compliance with international export control legislation and regulations.

Equal Opportunity Statement:

Lockheed Martin supports Equal Employment Opportunity and Diversity in the workplace by creating a place of employment that is, harassment free, diverse, fair, ethical, inclusive, and values the contribution of all its employees. Diversity and inclusion are the foundation of our culture and reflect our values of doing what’s right, respecting others and performing with excellence. By leveraging our employees’ unique talents and experiences, we will deliver innovative, affordable solutions and unparalleled customer value.

We welcome and actively encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people.

We are committed to creating a workplace where everyone can thrive. If you are selected for this role, we would be happy to discuss any accommodations that will help you to be successful.

Salary: Online Discount Program, Puchase extra leave
Ad Text:
About us:

At Lockheed Martin Australia, we believe that when people are empowered, inspired, and supported, they can achieve extraordinary things. We embrace flexibility, so our people can be their best inside and outside of work. We champion inclusion and continuous learning, ensuring all voices are heard and valued. And we thrive on collaboration, turning challenges into opportunities for growth and innovation.  As a leader in national security, our innovative and diverse programs create a more secure future for Australia across space, air, land, sea, and cyber domains. Every day is a chance to solve the world’s most complex challenges and make a profound impact. Experience it here.

About the program

AIR6500 is the RAAF’s $3 billion program to develop a joint air battle management system that builds on the capabilities offered by Next Generation sensor and command and control systems. AIR6500 will create a fully networked ‘system of systems’ that synchronises air and missile defence operations in joint and coalition environments, maximising situational awareness and enhancing the speed of decision making across the battlespace.

The Royal Australian Air Force’s vision is to transform sensor and reporting platforms into a fully networked, 5th generation force able to prevail against the increasingly complex and lethal threats of warfare in the information age. Key to this vision is AIR6500, a joint battle management system that will interconnect the many disparate platforms, systems and sensors across the air, land space, electromagnetic and cyber domains into a collaborative environment that provides shared situational awareness of the battlespace and the ability to rapidly plan responses to threats.

AIR6500 is a focussed LMA program that will deliver web-based cloud service systems to develop and connect sensors with operational awareness and reporting systems to provide a representative holistic threat response environment.

Responsibilities

Working as an integral member of the team, the primary responsibility of the Software Engineering position is to undertake engineering support activities contributing to the development of project software related deliverables to ensure all technical and quality requirements are met.

Responding to the AIR6500 Engineering Support EPM, you will undertake activities with customers and team to identify, analyse, select and apply concepts, technologies and techniques that are applicable to the technical development of software products.

In performing this role, you will be required to actively support the agile development of complex technical solutions proposed by yourself and team Subject Matter Experts, including the development of software requirement, design and test rationale and the implementation of code and unit test whilst overcoming project technical issues within an agile team environment.

You will also be responsible for resolution of problems identified during the conduct of software development, integration and test of your products and support the development of junior engineering staff.

About you:

To be successful in this role you will also have:

·         Extensive knowledge of Software Engineering process, procedures and the overall engineering product lifecycle.

·         Advanced experience in software engineering methodologies and techniques preferably in a web-based development domain.

·         Advanced experience leading and/or managing multiple small teams to successful system outcomes.

·         Excellent ability to apply experiential judgement and lateral approaches to complex problem solving.

·         Significant experience with Go, Typescript, Python, Java and C++.

·         Experience with web application frameworks such as Angular, React, Vue. -

·         Experience with Geospatial data and presentation tools (mapping, plotting, transforms, Cesium, OpenLayers, etc). - Desirable

·         Agile software development and team leading experience. - Desirable

·         Experience with Cloud Orchestration platforms (Kubernetes). - Desirable

How we reward and support you:

 When you join Lockheed Martin, you work on projects you won’t experience anywhere else.

We offer you a range of benefits built to suit you, no matter what stage of life you are in. 

·         Flexible work & Hybrid work options

·         Access to our online discounts program offering immediate discounts or cashback

·         A variety of leave options including Purchase Leave to support you and your family  

·         Additional benefits such as Novated Leasing and Fitness Programs

·         Learning & Development platforms to encourage ongoing self-development

Special Requirements:

Applicants must be eligible to obtain and maintain an Australian Defence Security Clearance and employment may be contingent on the provision of further personal information including citizenship to ensure compliance with international export control legislation and regulations.

Lockheed Martin supports Equal Employment Opportunity and Diversity in the workplace by creating a place of employment that is, harassment free, diverse, fair, ethical, inclusive, and values the contribution of all its employees. Diversity and inclusion are the foundation of our culture and reflect our values of doing what’s right, respecting others and performing with excellence. By leveraging our employees’ unique talents and experiences, we will deliver innovative, affordable solutions and unparalleled customer value.

We welcome and actively encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people.

We are committed to creating a workplace where everyone can thrive. If you are selected for this role, we would be happy to discuss any accommodations that will help you to be successful.

At Lockheed Martin Australia, we believe that when people are empowered, inspired, and supported, they can achieve extraordinary things. About the program

AIR6500 is the RAAF’s $3 billion program to develop a joint air battle management system that builds on the capabilities offered by Next Generation sensor and command and control systems. AIR6500 will create a fully networked ‘system of systems’ that synchronises air and missile defence operations in joint and coalition environments, maximising situational awareness and enhancing the speed of decision making across the battlespace.

Responsibilities

Working on the AIR6500 project the Network Architect will provide services including but not limited to:

·         Lead the design on the Network Architecture across the AIR6500 solution

·         Develop secure and resilient architectures to meet the AIR6500 needs

·         Work with IPTs and System Architects to guide hardware requirements

·         Drive security by design into the Network Architecture

·         Lead the development of key AIR6500 technical documents and artefacts such as network solution description, trade studies and definition of requirements

·         Establish the Network Architecture baseline, working with CM/DM team to manage the components, parts and assemblies within Configuration Management Tool

·         Author technical documentation and develop Technical Data packs as required

·         Contribute to the development and conduct of Technical Reviews

·         Decompose and capture sub-system requirements within the requirements management tool, DOORSNG, including traceability and verification methodology

·         Develop Test Plans, Procedures and Test reports as required

·         Engage with AIR6500 IPTs and Specialty Engineering groups to ensure common understanding of requirements and design considerations

·         Perform Trade Studies to evaluate possible technical substitutions as required

About you:

To be successful in this role you will also have:

·         Experience in designing and implementing complex network architectures

·         Advanced knowledge in routing, switching and firewall technologies

·         Relevant qualifications, experience or certifications (e.g. CCNP/CCIE)

·         Awareness of security frameworks, governance and compliance (e.g. ISM, PSPF)

·         Extensive analysis skills with an ability to develop and evaluate alternatives to determine best value based on customer-provided performance weighting

·         Proficient in concept development

·         Advanced verbal communication skills including both speaking and listening to the customer

Any knowledge or awareness of:

o   Model-based Systems development and model-based Engineering principles

o   Ground-based Sensors

o   Ground-based Effectors

o   Infrastructure software technologies include virtualisation, multi-level security, cyber defence, network accreditation, information assurance, system management

o   Infrastructure hardware technologies including computing (servers, clients, storage) network, cross domain solutions

o   Agile Engineering Methodology

o   Configuration Management principals and experience with configuration management tool EPDM

Ad Text:
About us:

At Lockheed Martin Australia, we believe that when people are empowered, inspired, and supported, they can achieve extraordinary things. We embrace flexibility, so our people can be their best inside and outside of work. We champion inclusion and continuous learning, ensuring all voices are heard and valued. And we thrive on collaboration, turning challenges into opportunities for growth and innovation.  As a leader in national security, our innovative and diverse programs create a more secure future for Australia across space, air, land, sea, and cyber domains. Every day is a chance to solve the world’s most complex challenges and make a profound impact. Experience it here.

Responsibilities

The senior cyber architect’s primary responsibilities include:

•        Provide a high level of advice and guidance to a range of stakeholders across the Company with respect to current security measures and recommendations for the implementation of enhancements

•        Provide broad based experience in systems engineering lifecycle & apply experience to specific Cyber Security initiatives relating to architectural design & development

•        Assist with regular cyber testing of systems to ensure continuous security monitoring

•        Support ongoing planning and estimating, status monitoring, measurement and reporting regimes for cyber security activities

•        Develop solutions to a variety of complex problems and provide and implement effective approved solutions

•        Actively attend and contribute to customer meetings as required

•        Actively contribute to the successful completion of specific programs and initiatives

•        Establish and maintain appropriate working relationships, ensuring effective and professional interaction with Lockheed Martin (LM) management, employees, customers, contractors and suppliers

About you:

To be successful in this role you will also have:

·         Significant experience with the systems engineering lifecycle

·         Solid experience in reviewing, interpreting and implementing Information Security Manual or NIST SP 800-53 controls

·         Experience in interpreting security requirements, analysing and recommending security measures and policies Significant experience in risk identification & mitigation practices, including seeking opportunities for continuous business improvement

·         Experience in the evaluation of ICT infrastructure (Hardware/Software) configurations for security vulnerabilities

Equal Opportunity Statement:

Lockheed Martin supports Equal Employment Opportunity and Diversity in the workplace by creating a place of employment that is, harassment free, diverse, fair, ethical, inclusive, and values the contribution of all its employees. Diversity and inclusion are the foundation of our culture and reflect our values of doing what’s right, respecting others and performing with excellence. By leveraging our employees’ unique talents and experiences, we will deliver innovative, affordable solutions and unparalleled customer value.

We welcome and actively encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people.

We are committed to creating a workplace where everyone can thrive. If you are selected for this role, we would be happy to discuss any accommodations that will help you to be successful.
